CountryData.name: Aland Islands
CountryData.description: The Aland Islands are an autonomous archipelago within Finland, located in the Baltic Sea.  They possess a unique blend of Finnish and Swedish cultures, reflected in their language, traditions, and legal system.  Characterized by stunning coastal scenery, dense forests, numerous islands, and a rich maritime history, the Aland Islands offer a tranquil and captivating destination for nature lovers, history enthusiasts, and those seeking a peaceful escape.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of the Aland Islands is primarily Swedish-speaking.
quickFacts.detail: The islands have a relatively stable population, with a significant proportion of residents being born and raised on the archipelago.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The Aland Islands consist of over 6,700 islands and islets.
quickFacts.detail: The largest island is Fasta Åland, which covers approximately 80% of the archipelago's land area.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Mariehamn is the largest town and administrative center.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a charming port town with a vibrant cultural scene and a well-preserved historic center.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.detail: Finnish is also widely spoken, and bilingualism is common.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Aland Islands use the Euro.
quickFacts.detail: However, they have a slightly different monetary system, with a unique Aland mark.

quickFacts.label: Government
quickFacts.description: The Aland Islands have a high degree of autonomy within Finland.
quickFacts.detail: They have their own parliament, government, and legal system.

climateData.title: Aland Islands Climate
climateData.description: The Aland Islands experience a temperate maritime climate, characterized by cool summers and mild winters.  The Gulf Stream moderates temperatures, resulting in relatively warm summers compared to other regions at similar latitudes. Precipitation is fairly evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and pleasant with long daylight hours.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cool and misty, with vibrant autumn foliage.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and often cloudy, with occasional snowfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild and gradually warming, with blossoming flowers.

naturalWonders.name: Fasta Åland
naturalWonders.description: Fasta Åland is the largest island in the Aland Islands, boasting a diverse landscape of forests, lakes, and coastal areas. Its rolling hills, picturesque villages, and abundant wildlife offer a stunning natural setting.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island’s interior is dominated by the vast and ancient Fasta Åland forest, one of the largest contiguous forests in Finland. The coastline is characterized by rocky shores, sandy beaches, and numerous bays and inlets.  Numerous small lakes dot the landscape, providing opportunities for boating and fishing.
viewingTips: Explore the forest trails on foot or by bike.
Visit the Kustavi lighthouse for panoramic views.
Take a boat trip to explore the coastline.

naturalWonders.name: Koster Islands
naturalWonders.description: The Koster Islands are a group of islands located off the southern coast of Fasta Åland. Known for their pristine beaches, diverse birdlife, and dramatic coastal scenery, they are a haven for nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The islands are composed of three main islands: Stor Koster, Mellankoster, and Små Koster. Stor Koster is the largest and most populated, while Små Koster is a small, uninhabited island. The islands are renowned for their sandy beaches, crystal-clear waters, and abundant marine life. They are also a vital breeding ground for numerous bird species.
viewingTips: Go birdwatching at the Kosterhavet National Park.
Take a boat trip to explore the islands.

ecosystemData.title: Aland Islands Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The Aland Islands boast a rich and diverse ecosystem, shaped by their unique geographical location and maritime environment.  The islands support a wide range of flora and fauna, including numerous bird species, marine mammals, and forest ecosystems.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The Aland Islands are covered in extensive forests, primarily consisting of Scots pine and Norway spruce.

statistics.details: Approximately 65% of the islands' land area is covered by forests.
The dominant tree species are Scots pine and Norway spruce.

notableSpecies.name: Scots Pine
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the forest ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Norway Spruce
notableSpecies.significance: Provides habitat for numerous bird species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The Aland Islands' coastline is characterized by rocky shores, sandy beaches, and extensive mudflats.

statistics.details: Approximately 150 km of coastline consists of sandy beaches.
Extensive mudflats provide important feeding grounds for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Grey Seal
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of coastal ecosystem health.

notableSpecies.name: Atlantic Puffin
notableSpecies.significance: A breeding colony is found on the Koster Islands.

activities.title: Activities in Aland Islands
activities.description: The Aland Islands offer a wide range of outdoor activities throughout the year, catering to all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands' diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.description: Hike through the ancient Fasta Åland Forest, enjoying the tranquility of the wilderness.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, waterproof jacket, map, compass
safety: Check weather conditions before setting out.

activities.name: Koster Islands Coastal Trail
activities.description: Walk along the scenic coastal trail of the Koster Islands, enjoying the stunning views.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of the Baltic Sea.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and islands by kayak.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Sail the waters of the Aland Islands.
